message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.LG

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper proposes a partner selection protocol based on real-time estimation of a function of fading parameters, i.e., the coding gain. This involves information theory concepts such as channel coding and decoding. 
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper deals with cooperative wireless networks and proposes a partner selection protocol for enhancing network lifetime. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes a stochastic bivariate model for the spatial distribution of the fading parameters that govern the link performance and uses a Bayesian approach for link quality estimation. These are system modeling and control techniques. 
4. cs.MM (Multimedia): The paper deals with wireless transmission of multimedia data from indoor nodes to an outdoor access point. 
5. cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper proposes a Bayesian approach for link quality estimation that uses a site-specific bivariate model as a-priori information. This involves machine learning techniques for probabilistic modeling and estimation.
